page.title: 10PRIMARY SCHOOL AT KEMPSFORD
page.content: {Kempsford C.of E. (Voluntary {Controlled) Primary School}is operated by the{Gloucestershire}County Council Education Committee although pupils are accepted from adjoining villages in{Wiltshire.}Pupils are aged from 4 to 11 years when they transfer to secondary schools. There are 73 on roll equally divided among the year groups. There are three classes in permanent wooden buildings with three full time teachers (including the Head) and a part time teacher working half time. The 19th century Cotswold type school house has been adapted and the expenses including running costs are paid by the Parents Association to provide a staffroom, library, kitchen, and medical room. The original school building is used as a hall and kitchen for activities and dinners.There are hard and grass playing areas.
